alert.note: Alert for Coastal Hancock; Coastal Washington (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Warning issued January 09 at 3:11PM EST until January 10 at 11:00AM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM TO 11 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Minor to moderate coastal flooding. One foot of inundation above ground level expected in low-lying areas near shorelines, with localized inundation up to 2 feet. * WHERE...Coastal Hancock and Coastal Washington Counties. * WHEN...From 7 AM to 11 AM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Inundation could affect locations such as Deer Isle Causeway, Oak Point Causeway on Deer Isle, Machias, Stonington, Bangor and South Lubec. Large breaking waves will cause overtopping of exposed coastal roadways, allowing large rocks to cause damage to vehicles. Areas of concern include but are not limited to, Schoodic Point and Seawall Road. Road debris and minor road damage could close some roadways. Beach erosion is expected at locations such as Roque Bluffs. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. info.instruction: Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. If travel is required, do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth.
